text: Opening a handle to a device in Python on Windows
I'm trying to use the giveio.sys driver which requires a "file" to be opened before you can access protected memory.
I'm looking at a C example from WinAVR/AVRdude that uses the syntax:

code:
#define DRIVERNAME      "\\\\.\\giveio"
 HANDLE h = CreateFile(DRIVERNAME,
            GENERIC_READ,
            0,
            NULL,
            OPEN_EXISTING,
            FILE_ATTRIBUTE_NORMAL,
            NULL);

text: but this does not seem to work in Python - I just get a "The specified path is invalid" error, for both
Why doesn't this do the same thing?
Edited to hopefully reduce confusion of ideas (thanks Will).
I did verify that the device driver is running via the batch files that come with AVRdude.
Further edited to clarify SamB's bounty.
